intro: Paronychia nivea, commonly known as the snowflake plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its ornamental value comes from its delicate appearance and ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
